data.title: My six best books- Susannah Harker
data.meta_description: SUSANNAH Harker, 47, is best known for playing Mattie Storin in House Of Cards and Jane Bennet in the TV adaptation  of Pride And Prejudice. She will be in Abigail’s Party at Wyndham’s Theatre from May 15. For more information call 0844 482 5120 or go to www.delfont mackintosh.co.uk
data.text:
Jane Eyre

by Charlotte Brontë

Penguin, £6.99

I first read this as a teenager at a convent school when I was young and easily influenced. It really chimed with where I was: we were both young women caught up in very intense situations. Later in my 20s I read Jean Rhys’ prequel Wide Sargasso Sea which was also a big fascination. I identified with Jane as an outsider caught up in an intense romantic situation. The Victorian integrity of the book appealed.

The House Of The Spirits

by Isabel Allende

Vintage, £8.99

I love rich South American mystical and political books and I loved the expanse of this epic spanning generations. It felt enormous and spiritual and very feminine.

The Magus

by John Fowles

Vintage, £8.99

A friend gave me this which is very different: very Sixties and masculine. The opposite of Allende’s book. It was very influential and is enormous: you disappear into it.

Four Letters Of Love

by Niall Williams

Picador, £7.99

A romantic, intense dramatic read about the relationship between a father and son. It is a personal and special book to me which I give to close friends and family. They find it reflects something in their lives. It is poetic, harrowing and realistic about love.

Into The Silent Land

by Paul Broks

Atlantic, £8.99

Broks is a neuropsychologist and these short stories are philosophical explorations of the mind, consciousness and imagination. It is funny, poetic and stimulating as he asks questions about who and what we are.

Howards End

by EM Forster

Penguin, £8.99

I read this for an audiobook recently and fell for it. It chimed with me as my family had a cottage that we shared like Howards End. I love when you read something from long ago and it feels so fresh.
